work.name: Mohamed bin Zayed University of Artificial Intelligence
work.summary: I worked on multilingual NLP, focusing on the cultural adaptation of large language models as well as the application of NLP in education within multilingual settings.

work.name: EvidenceB, AI Research team
work.summary: I explore the use of LLMs (GPT-4o and Llama-3-8B-instruct) as teachers to generate effective hints for students simulated through LLMs (GPT-3.5-turbo, Llama-3-8B-Instruct, Mistral-7B-instruct-v0.3) tackling math exercises designed for human high-school students, and designed using cognitive science principles. I Identified common student errors, developed hint prompts to aid re-correction, and compared teacher models performance using best prompt in generating pedagogically effective hints

work.name: CIRST-Université Quebec à Montréal
work.summary: During this internship, I conducted a study to assess the robustness of monolingual and multilingual language models to specific linguistic structures within the context of suicide prevention tools aimed at accommodating the cultural diversity of individuals in distress. I trained XLM-R, distiluse-base, and CamemBERT-base models on a dataset of French sentence pairs using the simple contrastive learning of sentence embeddings(SimCSE) method.

work.name: Digital Research Center of Sfax
work.summary: During this internship at the BRAIN4ICT team, I contributed to the development of a platform designed to analyze product reviews written in Francamglais—a Cameroonian dialect blending French, English, and local languages. The goal was to accurately capture and classify user sentiment expressed in this unique linguistic setting.
